alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 7:04PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream, creek flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Maine, including the following county, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 702 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms earlier. This will cause continue runoff and small stream flooding. Rapid stream and creek rises will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Dirt road and ATV trail washouts are likely. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Van Buren, Woodland, Madawaska Lake, New Sweden, Connor, Perham, Stockholm, Westmanland and Cyr Plantation. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
